title: Boxing news: Deontay Wilder is convinced it is his destiny to become undisputed heavyweight champion
text:
Deontay Wilder insists he will become the undisputed heavyweight champion.

The WBC champion will make his 10th defence of that crown on November 23 when he has a rematch with Luis Ortiz in Las Vegas, who he knocked out in 10 rounds in their clash last year.

Wilder also currently has plans to take on Tyson Fury in a second bout between the pair in February next year.

Deontay Wilder is convinced he will become the undisputed heavyweight champion

There are doubts over Tyson Fury's recovery from his cuts, so Wilder has changed his focus

There are doubts over the Fury rematch due to the two cuts the Brit sustained in his win against Otto Wallin in September.

Wilder has therefore set his sights on holding all four heavyweight crowns. The American is convinced he will beat Ortiz and then take on and overcome the winner of Anthony Joshua-Andy Ruiz Jr II.

Joshua lost for the first time as a professional in a shock defeat in seven rounds against Ruiz in June.

The WBC champion will make his 10th defence on November 23 against Luis Ortiz

'There will be one champion, one face, one name. He goes by the name of Deontay Wilder,' the 33-year-old told Sky Sports.

'If all goes well. It ain't just up to me. But I speak with confidence. I know all things will come to plan.

'It's up to other people to get their jobs done but I believe that, when they do, the world is going to see one of the biggest fights of their lives.

'What other man deserved it than I? I am a leader, a king, a ruler. I have power in my tongue. Things come to pass when I speak.'
